data.title: The Best Country Singers From Missouri
data.meta_description: Over 200 music fans have voted on the 50+ Best Country Singers From Missouri. Current Top 3: Chris Janson, Sara Evans, Sheryl Crow
data.text:
Hailing from Perryville, Missouri, Chris Janson expertly blends traditional country sounds with a contemporary edge, making him a leading figure in the state's music scene. Throughout his career, Janson has drawn inspiration from Missouri's rich musical heritage, incorporating elements of country, rock, and blues into his dynamic sound. With chart-topping hits like "Buy Me A Boat" and "Fix A Drink," he has secured his place among Missouri's elite country musicians, helping to keep the heartland's spirit alive in modern country music. Janson's authenticity and undeniable talent have catapulted him to national recognition and made him a proud ambassador for Missouri's thriving musical culture.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From Chris Janson

- "Buy Me a Boat"

- "Fix A Drink"

- "Good Vibes"

Dive Into Chris Janson's History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "Holdin' Her"

- "Cut Me Some Slack"

Born in Boonville, Missouri, Sara Evans deftly combines her small-town roots with a polished country-pop sound, making her a standout artist within the ever-evolving world of country music. Recognized for her heartfelt lyrics and powerful vocals, Evans showcases her Missouri upbringing through her storytelling and emotive performances. As a stalwart in the industry for over two decades, she has helped shape the landscape of country music, expanding Missouri's presence on a mainstream level. Sara Evans' commitment to maintaining the essence of her origins while embracing contemporary influences has solidified her status as a beloved icon of Missouri's country music scene.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From Sara Evans

- "Suds In The Bucket"

- "A Little Bit Stronger"

- "Born to Fly"

Dive Into Sara Evans's History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "I Could Not Ask For More"

- "Big Cry"

Born in Kennett, Missouri, Sheryl Crow is a multi-genre artist best known for her rock-rooted sound, yet her undeniable ties to country music remain a key element of her artistic identity. Drawing from a diverse pool of influences, including Missouri's rich musical history, Crow seamlessly infuses country elements into her trademark style, expertly conveying the region's eclectic spirit. Though often associated with her classic rock & roll sound, her 2013 country album, Feels Like Home, cemented her position as an accomplished country singer, expanding Missouri's reach within the genre. Sheryl Crow's dynamic sound serves as a testament to both her versatility and her deep connection to her home state, making her a true embodiment of Missouri's multifaceted music scene.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From Sheryl Crow

- "Soak Up The Sun"

- "All I Wanna Do"

- "My Favorite Mistake"

Dive Into Sheryl Crow's History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "Strong Enough"

- "Anything But Down"

From the small town of Pocahontas, Illinois, just across the river from St. Louis, Missouri, Gretchen Wilson burst onto the country scene with her gritty, unapologetic sound that embodies the spirit of the region. With her breakout 2004 hit "Redneck Woman," Wilson captured the essence of life in the Missouri-Illinois borderlands, delivering a hard-hitting sound infused with traditional country sensibilities. Her honest lyrics and powerhouse vocals have since made her a force to be reckoned with in the industry, elevating Missouri's homegrown talent on the national stage. Gretchen Wilson's fearless spirit and undeniable talent have left an indelible mark on country music, making her one of Missouri's most celebrated artists.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From Gretchen Wilson

- "Redneck Woman"

- "Here For The Party"

- "All Jacked Up"

Dive Into Gretchen Wilson's History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "When I Think About Cheating"

- "The Earrings Song"

A revered icon hailing from West Plains, Missouri, Porter Wagoner made his mark on the country music scene with his distinctive blend of honky-tonk, southern gospel, and rockabilly. Known for his flashy rhinestone suits and smooth baritone voice, Wagoner captivated audiences while staying true to Missouri's musical roots. With a career spanning over five decades, he played a pivotal role in shaping the genre's development and helped bring Missouri's unique sound to the forefront of country music. Porter Wagoner remains an enduring symbol of Missouri's rich musical culture, leaving a lasting legacy as one of the state's most influential artists ever.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From Porter Wagoner

- "Green, Green Grass Of Home"

- "The Carroll County Accident"

- "Misery Loves Company"

Dive Into Porter Wagoner's History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "Cold Hard Facts Of Life"

- "The Bottom Of The Bottle"

Missouri-born and bred, Boxcar Willie, whose real name was Lecil Travis Martin, made a name for himself with his unique blend of country, folk, and blues music that harkens back to the state's rich musical heritage. Embracing his humble beginnings in Sterrett, Missouri, he earned the nickname "Boxcar Willie" for his trademark freight-train sounds, which perfectly capture the spirit of the American heartland and its working-class heroes. His distinctive voice and nostalgic, yet innovative, sound resonated with fans around the world, earning him a place in the Grand Ole Opry and cementing his status as a country legend. Boxcar Willie's commitment to preserving Missouri's musical legacy made a lasting impact on the genre and solidified his place among the state's greats.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From Boxcar Willie

- "King of the Road"

- "I Saw the Light"

- "Wabash Cannonball"

Dive Into Boxcar Willie's History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "Train Medley"

- "Peace in the Valley"
